name: Coconut Palms Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't add much to the positives reviews written on the Coconut Palms. This is not four star luxury and it is not four star price. It is located in a residential neighborhood and you can see chickens on the street. The place is right on the beach and that did present a slight problem for my wife - crashing surf so I have to chop down sleep quality
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The room we stayed in - Whale - had a refrigerator and microwave so you can do some shopping at nearby grocery stores and cook on their outdoor grill. If you wish to have a resort feel just turn right on the beach for a five minute walk to a resort with a bar and fine dining.
reviews.title: It has a gorgeous view & location, comfortable surroundings, and a friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife went to the beach by the lighthouse about a 3 mile drive and I went along simply because I don't care for the beach but am a runner. At the lighthouse you simply drive another 1/4 mile and reach a water tower. To your left is a great beach and to your right there are miles of trails for bikes and horses that honeycomb the area.
reviews.title: You can't go wrong with Coconut Palms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for three days and found it to be be exactly as the other reviews had written. It has a cozy at home feel and the people in and around the hotel are very friendly and laid back. I stayed in the Gecko Room, it is on the first floor and the ocean waves were thrashing about 12 feet from my room (due to the hurricane that just broke up over Haiti). The weather was off and on with rain & sun (just like my home in Florida), but for the most part, the views are stunning. I would stay there again for a few days for sure next time I go down there. I also came home with the best souvenir from the hotel, which is a kitten I named Dińero. Thanks Gayle!
reviews.title: Perfect Place to stay for a couple :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at this inn, the staff were friendly and helpful and the surroundings are beautiful. The veranda and cooking area was very relaxing and it was great to be able to cook meals, we even got to share with other guests so it became like a party. there's even a great supermarket within walking distance. Rincon's great, Coconut Palms is great, hope to go back soon.
reviews.title: The perfect Getaway !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Must go here!
reviews.title: Absolutely Splendid!! Look no further!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't even put into words how wonderful this place is. Gail is an absolute delight. The staff was delightful and the place enchanting. The apartment we chose was great and all of the people staying at this beautiful inn were totally happy as well. A few nights all of us got together and barbecued and it seemed as if the whole inn was on the back deck!! Everything is near! !Beach is a couple steps away (literally) Beach bar a couple blocks down the beach. I would say rent a car so you can sightsee and although things are near, they are a little far for walking. check it out, you won't be dissapointed!
reviews.title: Um. Hello Beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Coconut Palms was lovely. We had such a great time. It was the type of vacation we love. Low key and easy. As an 8-room inn, this is a perfect place to getaway and be private. Our room was right on the beach and going to sleep with the sound of the water was great. The porch had an outdoor grill and if we were staying the full week, we probably would have cooked more. But we were only there for 3 nights and ended up going out to eat more.
reviews.title: Paradise found

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rooms all had mini fridges, microwaves and coffee makers. The beachside room was small, but you're never in the room so it didn't matter. AC and Ceiling fans kept the rooms very comfortable. And their cleaning woman is top notch (don't forget to leave a tip for her!!)
reviews.title: The most inviting and relaxing atmosphere in any vacation experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was really amazing and personable. Kristen was the best - and her boyfriend gives the best surfing lessons with Surf 787 (note: always do surf lessons one on one. Don't do that group stuff!). Gail, the owner, was in one word: Awesome. Just laid back, cool and helpful.
reviews.title: Best Value on The Beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Coconut Palms from 6/3-6/5...the last 2 days of our trip around PR. I loved that the beach was literally right outside and I could hear the waves. The place could use some upgrades but I like how no one bothered us and it was so quiet and relaxing. Rosie was very nice and so was the other guy that was there at night (I'm sorry I forgot his name). Beau the black lab is so cute! I fell in love with him and Evie (the black and tan cat). I would stay there again if I was going there with my husband. I don't think it would be a great place to stay with children. My daughter would get bored quickly but it is so peaceful and romantic there so if that's what you're looking for that then it's a good place to stay at.
reviews.title: Would stay there again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 days from the 19th of May. As soon as we walked in we regretted not booking the room longer - it was that wonderful. Angel was the best, making you feel welcomed and ever so friendly and helpful .We had The Coqui room and it was just a marvelous experience fallind asleep to the sound of the waves and opening the door in the morning to have your breath taken away from the beauty of the sea and just steps away from the beach. We cant wait to return the next time for a bit longer.
reviews.title: Falling asleep to the sound of the waves will be unforgettable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Inn and really enjoyed it there, the staff was very open and treated us as friends. They will go out of their way to help you & make your time there a wonderful stay! They ahve a nice beachfront view and BQ is open for all to use, and they have a really nice courtyard with many places to sit and do as you like, eat - read or whatever.
reviews.title: Nice place beautiful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rincon is a great place. The people were all friendly in the small town. Drive around when you there, the hills right around the beach are awesome. PR has very diverse landscape, wherever you go, it changes. Rincon is close to Camuy and the radio tower, another wonderful place to visit while in this area. We drove back the scenic route 111.
reviews.title: Awesome! Relaxing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010
reviews.text: The Inn is older, rooms are clean and the garden is very well kept and relaxing. The patio is awesome. We spent every night there and it has a big grill available for cooking.
reviews.title: Awsome!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This place is absolutely wonderful for anyone who likes a no-frills, feel-at-home place to sit, relax and enjoy the beach. The place is simple, but has all you need to build a BBQ facing the beach or just lounge to face a beautiful sunset. The staff is friendly and nice. And if you miss your dog, Beau is there to keep you company.
reviews.title: What a fanntastic cozy spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Thanks to Angel and Gail for making us feel right at home!
reviews.title: Perfect fit for a relaxing stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Coconut Palms Inn was the perfect match for my husband, my teenaged daughter, her friend, and myself. The property is right on the beach and within walking distance to area attractions (grocery store, restaurants, etc). There are several different room choices that are all clean and well maintained. There is a wonderful patio with large dining area and grill.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Coconut Palms for 4 nights at the end of March 2010. This place was just perfect. We absolutely LOVED the location, staff, Beau and atmosphere. Our whole stay was peaceful and relaxing. Despite traveling during spring break week, none of those shenanigans were anywhere to be found. (Hurray!) The inn is clean, clean, clean and staff is super helpful.
reviews.title: A very nice inn in a lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is just steps from each room so that you can lay in the sun & relax or float on provided beach toys as soon as you wake up in the morning.
reviews.title: The Coconut Palms is an affordable and undiscovered gem of Rincon!

description: Lovely small mediterranean style inn, located directly on Playa Rincon (Rincon Beach). Faces due west to the ocean and sunset and has a romantic tropical garden. Apartments and studios include A/C, color cable TV, Wi Fi internet, daily housekeeping and laundry service and fully equipped. Included are; coolers, beach toys and floats, BBQ's and Hammock. Great place to relax among lush gardens and a beautiful beach.
